comments: a(n+3) = A^(n)B^(2)(1), n>=0, with compositions of Wythoff's complementary A(n):=A000201(n) and B(n)=A001950(n) sequences. See the W. Lang link under A135817 for the Wythoff representation of numbers (with A as 1 and B as 0 and the argument 1 omitted). E.g. 5=`00`, 8=`100`, 12=`1100`,..., in Wythoff code.
